Mar 4, 2023
Firechick12012
Recommended 





                Don't you just love it when you discover little gems when you least expect it? BL Metamorphosis is a short manga about two people bonding over a shared interest, and I'm kind of a huge sucker for stories like that. It's mainly because growing up, I didn't have a lot of friends in school because I was the weird girl who loved anime, manga, and games and wasn't interested in things my peers liked, such as gossiping about boys, makeup, fashion, and so on. Not that there's anything wrong with liking those things, mind you, they just weren't in my wheelhouse. Actually meeting people who
                  ...
shared my passion for anime/manga always made me feel like I had ascended to Nirvana, filling me with so much joy that I'd feel like I was going to explode. But now that I'm adult, that joy has quieted down a bit, but feels no less fulfilling to me, especially since I now have a lot of friends who share my interests, both IRL and online. Having just discovered this manga recently, I'm kinda surprised I didn't read BL Metamorphosis sooner, because it perfectly captures the quiet yet fulfilling joy that people get when they bond over shared interests and fandoms. If this manga had come out when I was a kid, I probably would have ate it up like a wolf.

The story goes as follows: Yuki Ichinoi is a 75-year-old widow who has been content with wiling her days away teaching calligraphy classes, doing housework, and reading. While at the bookstore, she finds herself picking up a BL manga and is strangely fascinated by what she reads. One of the clerks in said bookstore, 17-year-old high school girl Urara Sayama, notices a budding fangirl when she sees one, mainly because she herself is a fan of BL manga, especially the series that Ichinoi starts reading. Gradually, the two of them become friends over their shared love of the series, with Urara teaching her all there is to know about BL manga as a whole, even if Urara is rather shy about expressing her interest. Their newfound friendship takes them in new directions, brightening their lives and enriching their days.

For anyone worried that the BL in the title means that BL will eventually take over the story, don't worry, it doesn't go in that direction. The manga itself is pretty wholesome, and BL Metamorphosis does show some excerpts from the series that Urara and Ichinoi love, and none of said scenes contain any graphic sexual content. BL in itself is more of a catalyst than the whole purpose of the story, and the premise is flexible enough that it can work with pretty much any hobby or passion, be it gardening, architecture, motorcycles, or painting. From a technical standpoint, the artwork in general is pretty nice, and has this casual, airy quality about it, especially the linework, that captures the tranquil, ordinary beauty of the world these characters live in. The backgrounds are well rendered and the characters have down-to-earth designs that are still distinct, so you can still tell who's who a lot of the time. I also appreciate that it actually manages to make Ichinoi look her age. Most mangaka struggle with drawing old people, either making them look like tiny cartoon dwarves or just standard young people with a few stray wrinkles drawn on. Kaori Tsurutani captures all the little details that come with old age, such as the boniness of Ichinoi's fingers and the papery-ness of her skin. Even her posture and body language are good at conveying the slowness of her movement, which is hard to do.

And to nobody's surprise, Ichinoi and Urara absolutely carry the manga on their backs. The duo make such a loveable pair and it's very sweet to watch the two of them grow and change over the course of the manga, whether it be Urara learning to embrace her interests and chase her dreams without shame or Ichinoi's well-intentioned bluntness and excitement upon embracing her new hobby. I could definitely relate to Urara feeling ashamed of her hobbies and feeling ostracized because she doesn't share the same interests as her peers and finding it hard to make friends her own age. When I was a kid and getting deep into anime/manga beyond Pokemon and Yu-Gi-Oh, I wanted to share my passions with everyone, but kids at school were either put off by it or picked on me afterward. The manga doesn't explain if Urara was bullied for her interests in the past, but it does a great job at conveying her anxiety and indecisiveness over whether she should embrace her authentic self or try to be normal, and her arc is very satisfying without taking the easy way out. Even some members of my immediate family were put off by some of the stuff I consumed, and explaining things didn't always help, so I started becoming more guarded and only shared my interests with those who already knew about it. Even most of the side characters have a surprising amount of depth and personality to them, such as the author of the manga Urara and Ichinoi like, who is surprisingly prominent. The only characters I don't have a good read on are Urara's childhood friend and his girlfriend. Their whole subplot really confused me, mainly because they don't get a lot of time to show what they're like and how or why they come to the decisions they make later on. They're not bad characters or anything, but I wish more could have been done with them and that there had been more clarity in regards to just what their deal is.

If you're someone who prefers your manga to be fast paced, action packed, and more on the loud and comedic side, you're probably not gonna like BL Metamorphosis. The manga takes pride in the fact that its a much quieter take on the premise of fandom. To quote another reviewer, so many manga about fandom are big—they focus on big emotions, big events, on collection and consumption. There's nothing inherently wrong with that if the execution is done well, but I wish more took the route BL Metamorphosis does, on how fandom can sometimes be the simple pleasure of meeting others who share an interest and turning that into friendship. It helps that the manga is pretty short and sweet, complete at 5 volumes, though I kind of wish it had been a bit longer so it could have explored some more things, like Urara's past, more of her male childhood friend, or even what Ichinoi was like back when she was younger and growing up when manga was making waves. That would have been an interesting angle. But nevertheless, I'm happy with BL Metamorphosis as it is. It's a sweet, wholesome, laid-back manga about two people from different points in life bonding over a new hobby and forging a friendship over it, and you know I'm always a sucker for those kinds of stories. And knowing that there's a live-action movie based on this, I kind of want to track it down and watch it. Hey Netflix! Care to stream that?

                Warning contains spoiler in the middle section!!!
Story 4/10
Artwork 8/10

When starting to read the manga it gives someone the idea that the plot is going to follow the following plot points:

-Girl get brutally inserted to a death game,
-The mob character she meets is very strong,
-They work together to win the game, while falling in love in each other
...

But when reading the manga further most people would have realised at this point that those are only some dreamy thoughts of a naive reader, because the story goes into some completely different direction.

(Spoiler warning!!!)


-The ML is some kind of twisted psychopath that craws for affection no matter what, because while reading, it shows that this guy is a control freak, insufferable for everybody involved (even the reader) and seem to cannot learn from anything.
And even his background story is fucked up because it showed that even as a kid, he craved for so much affection, that he manipulates everybody (even the viewer) for receiving even a little bit of affection.
-The FL let this psychopathic guy do everything to her and while forgiving him, while showing that she hates humanity for treading everybody like objects.
-The side characters can be listed in the following basic categories: The siscon, the similar like the FL innocent sister, the sadist girl and the masochist (He almost never speaks, but is most of the time around)

Before speaking further, we need to discuss the game they playing, it's a game where magical girl like people fight each other, while being controlled by a their partner, they alone can't do nothing and need to rely on their partner. Everybody has 3 lives after finishing the tutorial stage and need to fight in PvP battles to reach higher rank from F to SS, in SS rank they won the game and are free.

This cast is meeting each other after their fight with the main girl and guy, the main guy is outsmarting everyone what results to them winning every battle. This results to some tension between the main guy and the sadist girl, after they fought and after that teamed up with each other, what climaxed to the traumatisation of the sadist girl, trough torturing her, this results ultimately to even a greater splitting of the already very instable team.

And the FL? The main girl is playing the main guys puppet the whole time, not even thinking of revenge, while he abuses her sexually.


(Spoiler end)

(Personal opinion)
All in all, this manga is the first manga that ever awoken the emotion of being so disgusted of a character (ML), that it takes me here to write a review, because if this is the goal of the author, he done it great, because I'm disgusted.
This resulted that the even reading to chapter 71 was a chore that I don't want to repeat twice.

Tbh, the artwork is great and that is the main reason why I read this in the first place, but the abusive nature of everything in this manga drove me to dropping this manga and wanting me to go to the holy farther to confess my sins.

(Hope ya like ma first and prop. last review ever)

Undead Unluck
(Manga)
add

        (All reviews)
      







Mar 4, 2023
oliveirafre_rulz
RecommendedPreliminary
                
                                      (148/? chp)
                                   





                The art is very good, it's nothing amazing, but it's very clear and generally pleasant, unless we see a side shot of the face of any character in which case, it looks horrendous. The art is very consistent, until one point, which is the only time we really get a major change in the style, chapter 130-131, the fact it comes in so late makes the change so much more meaningful and gives the events that relate to it so much more power, it is amazing.

Okay, the 10 first chapters are just perfect. It is so funny, the characters are so intriguing, every new unlock
                  ...
is stupider than the last, the plot is so ridiculous, the way the fights are structured with an "information gathering" phase and then the actual fights is fascinating, the pacing's great. If the manga was just that, it would easily be a high 8.
After that, once Andy and Fuuko join the Union, it slows down for a bit and the more serious story starts to take its place while the jokes take a backseat (though the ones we get remain very funny) and we get a second introduction of sorts, it's still good, just not as good in my opinion as the first 10 chapters and that applies for the rest of the manga I think. 

However, we do start getting more characters, which are all absolutely amazing, their designs are each super great and distinct, their personalities are all very interesting. This truly applies to every character, including characters like Rip or Top who present archetypes I usually hate, or Creed who is unbelievably simple, yet still super interesting.
If this manga was nothing but the story of each of the character's backstory, it would be a 10/10, their stories are just this interesting and present such emotionally powerful scenes, I just want to learn more about them, all their misfortunes are so unique! Every time the story goes back to a misfortune that has already been presented to add detail unto it, it feels great. Every character interaction is just a joy to read.

The action scenes are good, but I personally feel that action scenes in general have a sort of hard cap on how good they can be without being animated (for instance Demon Slayer or Mob Psycho II) or being absolutely insane (Chainsaw Man or Goblin Slayer), since the Unluck Undead manga offers neither (until the God fight when Undecrease comes into play, HOLY SHIT, just thinking about it puts a smile on my face), they are good, but nothing more really. However, the non-conventional fight scenes like the fight against Spring are very good (but not amazing).

The setting is underdeveloped I think. We barely see any interactions with Apocalypse or any explanations relating to his rules, we don't see many artifacts and see even less of them being explained, Umas are explained in a way that doesn't make sense if we take into account what rule they are supposed to represent and how the world was before their existence, some rules seem to exist before their Umas do (Insect for instance (if we compare the 101th's loop's earth to the one where Insect was killed)), some Umas have rules that make no sense (Move or "Kain" for instance), some Umas seem to exist without Apocalypse, etc. The one chance we had to see a lot of Apocalypse is used to skip 26 years, there's so many little holes that feel like they could easily be patched up if the author just took the time to explain them properly. 

This leads me to my next point, negators are a mixed bag, most of them are pretty self-explanatory, like Unluck negating luck, Undead being unable to become dead, Undecrease being unable to run out of things, Unrepair making things impossible to fix, but others feel a little wonky like Untruth making people do the opposite of what they want (the part about them saying the opposite makes sense though), Unfair... just... I get it, but... why? Unruin and Unfade also make very little sense. That's not to say negators aren't great, most of their abilities are really interesting, but some others feel out of place like Umas.

The pacing is pretty bad honestly, it gets better during the 101th loop, but the problem is that the story seems to be too focused on doing 1 thing at a time, so we'll get 10 or more high speed, combat focused chapters before 5 or 6 slower chapters, but the fact that they are often so grouped up makes it so that the highs don't feel like highs (cough cough Spoil fight cough cough), because they are surrounded by other highs, and the lows don't feel like lows, because they are surrounded by other lows. It's a lot better when it mixes it up like during the Autumn fight or while Fuuko is looking for other negators.

The 101th loop is just god tier, the time skip feels like a huge shame, because it's more of my biggest problem with this manga, we don't see enough of the small things (artifacts, Umas and the world in general outside the main plot) to truly be able to appreciate the world, but what we do get is taking what the 100th loop did well and polishing it until no impurities remain, we don't just see the flashbacks about the misfortunes that every negator has, we see the misfortunes take place, it's so good. We get to learn about the characters we couldn't learn about in the previous loop, every little spec of information from the first part comes back into play, it's just amazing.

It's a mid 8. Because of the terrible pacing, while reading it, I was thinking more of giving it a high 7 or low 8, however, thinking back on it, it has so many memorable moments and such a powerful and interesting plot, I just can't give it any lower than a mid 8.

It was quite hell of a ride for me, personally. You may ask, why? Because my friend, I have a soft spot for slice of life manga whether it is shoujo or josei or shounen in a broader terms. And this manga has somewhat of everything in it.
                  ...
It has a little bit sci-fi (mostly coding related which I somewhat understood >_<), a little bit of slice of life, a little bit of shoujo (well, most of the times, it was a parody of shoujo...I will explain it in later part), a little bit of age-gap (age-gap of 8 years...uh-huh, my parents have 7-years of age-gap between them o_o) and lots of learning for a lifetime, at least for me personally.

Now, I'm going to talk about its each ingredient in detail. So bear with me... >_<
This manga is full of coding jargon...I wish I had an engineering or science background to tell whatever was written in the story if it was correct? But who cares, right? As long as it is not complicating the story or making it blend, it is alright. Well, this is the exact case with Dengeki Daisy. The science fiction parts doesn't hinder the story at all. The story moves at its own pace. You won't be rushed here. So, read it with a patient and calm mind. Okay? ^_^
Coming onto the shoujo aspect of it...I think it is quite different, in a good way, from you ideal shoujo manga. Here, the each character act as you and me. It means they are imperfect (mostly) and perfect (rarely) in their own way. They have their shortcomings and downfalls as well as they have their strengths. No one is ideal here. They make you realize that there is no ideal way to convey your feelings to your beloved ones...like there is no ideal way write down this review ^O^. Each character has their grey moments in the story. So, if you're someone who is idealistic shoujo manga reader, beware!!! because some moments or characters will repel you keep reading it. Please start it with open-mindedness >_<!
Talking about its art-style, I would say I'm not qualified enough to pass my judgement on art-style. For me, personally, I feel it is drawn with mangaka's sweat and tears (I mean hard work :D) and I don't want to disrespect her work by giving my opinions naively. Honestly, I appreciate her time, effort and hard work that she had put into creating it.

Lastly, I would just say that if you're considering to give it a try then sure, go ahead but with open-mindedness. Thank you for patience with me and being with me till here. See you in new story. Until then, take care! \_^o^_/

Last minute edit - Akira is my favourite one in this. I just loved his character. I still don't know why though! ~_~

Weekend Citron
(Manga)
add

        (All reviews)
      







Mar 4, 2023
WolfieGrrrl
Mixed Feelings 





                I've heard of people looking like their pets, but have you ever fallen in love with someone because THEY look like your beloved pet? Me neither.

Weekend Citron is an interesting BL that tries very hard to be sweet, but kind of forgets to build up much of a relationship between the characters beyond "oh, he's pretty" and "oh, he looks like my dog and lets me pet his hair", which is unfortunate because there is a lot of potential here. A pâtissier whose passion for baking comes from his connection to his grandmother, ultimately evolving into the only method he had for communicating with the
                  ...
world outside of his small familial bubble, is a fantastic concept that isn't explored deeply enough. In part, the short length of the series hinders a lot of that development, so it's only expected that certain aspects would fall to the wayside in favor of pushing the main leads together as quickly as possible. Not even acknowledging the fact that we know nothing about his love interest, there are unfortunately other problems that develop from this lack of in-depth characterization.

Jin's sad backstory explains why he is so closed off and awkward around others, but the story seems to almost infantilize him in the process. This becomes a problem during two scenes: one in which he is kissed without consent while passed out drunk and another in which our eyes are jumpscared with surprise smut.

At the very least, that kiss does get addressed as a wrong that has been committed... but the writing gives off the distinct impression that we, as readers, should be romanticizing Souichi's constant guilt over it. This all comes to a head during the chapter 4 smut scene where he starts seeing Jin as someone too pure and innocent for first kisses and sex. And yet, that doesn't stop him from forcing himself on Jin even though Jin tells him to stop. This still isn't the worst non-con I've seen from a BL, but it was definitely an uncomfortable escalation from the very sweet buildup to that moment.

The bonus chapter is a welcome breath of fresh air that introduces how the relationship between Ai and Makoto developed through the years. Unfortunately, it brings out the "remove glasses, braces, and baby fat to become hot" trope, which has become so old and worn by this point that all I can muster is a disappointed sigh in response. Other than that, it's cute and I wish I could have seen more of them being adorable together!

Overall, there are some really great moments in between the scenes that leave a lot to be desired. Unfortunately, chapter 4 can't just be skipped if you want to understand some important details from Jin's backstory, so brace yourself for the uncomfortable smut or commit yourself to skimming it like I did if the rest of the manga's concept intrigues you. Thankfully, the smut section is short enough.

                To start off, I don’t understand why people are so overly critical about this manga. Yes it’s super hyped, but comparing it to other SJ I feel like it’s done it’s job extremely well! Like honestly so many more issues with one piece in terms of art, characters, story, etc.

Plot 8.5/10
IMO naruto has a great world space, that is clearly the best to do the ninja genre on a large scale. The plot follows growth patterns that make sense, good pacing and overall easy concept of confronting hate/ conflict in the shinobi era. 

Characters 9/10
characters built on reasonably power scaling methods that feel unique and
                  ...
not like every character is super OP. Chakra to me seems to be one of the best power concepts in anime. Most of the characters are compelling and dynamic. Yes some of the later villain stuff seems rushed/forced but think of it to progress the plot to where it needs to be and for me it was fine. Yes Sakura is kinda of mediocre. Take in the different styles and affinity that let every character perform entirely unique jutsu.

Art 8.5/10
Nothing much to be said here, it’s not vagabond or berserk, it’s nice aesthetic without to much over saturation and the consistency remains at a high quality SJ.

Overall :

Naruto being so large scale with a large cast of characters; people tend to be extremely over critical of it. I think naruto can create a super impactful experience for anybody ! I’ll give it a 10 for the sake of what it accomplished for the genre, realistically it’s probably a 9.

                Fans of Chainsaw Man and Fire Punch will immediately recognize the same author, if indeed that isn't the reason you came here to begin with. Whether that is the reason or not, this one-shot is definitely worth reading if you have an hour or two to spare and enjoy a little slice of life.

For people that are familiar with Chainsaw Man or Fire Punch (and I promise to stop referencing them after this) you will see the same sort of style in this manga. I don't just mean the art, but also the author's tendency to have a scene show large progressions of time with
                  ...
very little movement, and then to have equally large momentous plot lines get delivered with shocking realism and a sober sense of clarity. Aside from one brief moment later in the manga, most of this is shockingly real to life and leaves you questioning things about yourself that you identify in the characters. 

Since the story is so short and sweet I won't give any details regarding it, except that it's a sort of coming-of-age/romance between two very different people who find that they aren't so different after all. My biggest complaint about this manga is that I felt the plot took an unexpected turn that didn't really feel earned and didn't land with the impact that it could've in a serialized manga. The plot turn later on is very interesting and meaningful, I  just feel like it was so out-of-place and sudden that the emotional impact was replaced with mild confusion. 

Otherwise definitely worth a read.

Ashita Tenki ni Naare
(Manga)
add

        (All reviews)
      







Mar 3, 2023
CLY-DH
Recommended 





                Ashita Tenki ni Naare is a long-running sports manga by well-known mangaka Chiba Tetsuya, and it is one of the most well-known golf manga. The main character is a student named Mukai Taiyou, who comes from a family that lacks financial freedoms, with the only adult being his mother who runs a restaurant, where the family resides on the second floor. As a result, Mukai shows great interest in earning money, and grabs any chance that presents itself, like asking his fellow classmates to be paid in return for certain tasks, such as predicting what will be in the next test. His ultimate goal, however,
                  ...
is to become a pro golfer, and be able to financially support his family. For this, he works part-time at a golf course, as well as being steadily taught by a former pro golfer on the side. As evident from these descriptions, Mukai is a hard-working, honest individual, but his greatest asset is his natural aptitude for the sport.

Chiba’s manga often portray those with a specific, extraordinary skill in the ordinary everyday; ones who can persevere through any hardships life may throw their way, from Yuki no Taiyou to Ashita no Joe. Taiyou is no different, able to overcome any obstacle in his path through perseverance, and much like the protagonists of Chiba’s other sports manga, he shows a natural adeptness to golf, and is very quickly able to show a level of skill that surpasses veterans much more seasoned to him.

There are many similarities that can be drawn between Taiyou as a character, to Teppei from Ore no Teppei, one of Chiba’s other sports manga. They are both rash, inexperienced, and quick to anger; but also quite clever, with a great amount of natural talent. Obviously, there are also differences, particularly with Taiyou being not quite as quick-witted as Teppei. Teppei, comparatively, can also be much more obnoxious and sneaky, whereas Taiyou generally doesn’t try to outwit his opponents through various methods, unless they attempt to outwit him first. One of the scenes in the manga shows this trait; during one of the competitions, when one of the other players attempts to thwart Taiyou’s play through dishonest conduct. Once Taiyou realizes this, he decides to reverse the situation, putting the pressure on that player, but through fully honest conduct, which eventually leads the other player to be unable to overcome that pressure instead.

There are a range of competitions shown in the manga, from a national golf competition for students, to The Open, one of the most revered golf competitions in the world. Present also are many real-life professional golf players from the period this manga was running; the most notable member of this lineup probably being Jack Nicklaus, generally considered to be among the greatest players in golf history. Though I am unfamiliar with pro golf, and these players are all before my time, for those who are knowledgeable, it would be amusing to see this kid beat out some of the greatest golf players in history.

The increase in scale of the competitions stands in contrast to Ore wa Teppei, where, though the competitions and opponents do gradually increase in skill, they are always national competitions, with the opponents always students. The increase in scale here is more comparable to Ashita no Joe, which also sees international opponents later on. However, Joe is older than Taiyou, and therefore the opponents, who are mostly all adults, feel that much more daunting here. Combined with Taiyou’s small stature (even the opponents often remark on the surprise they feel that such a small person is able to exert so much power), it makes his achievements seem all the more impressive.

Chiba’s art here is some of the best he’s ever drawn, and every golf match is presented with great intensity, and in such a way that is best conveyed as a comic. The ‘grittiness’ of Chiba’s art brings the characters, as well as the aesthetic of 1980s Japan, the central setting, to life, and his grounded yet stylized art allows for the golf courses to be presented to the reader with the feeling of magnificence they deserve. This is also achieved by a large helping of double page spreads throughout all the golf competitions, which overall, number much more compared to some of his other sports manga. The general visual presentation of the manga is also nothing short of impressive, with the powerful swings of the players being shown in all their double spread glory, and numerous smaller vertical panels being used when necessary, such as when a golf ball is shown falling from the sky, becoming gradually more visible in successive small panels as it falls, giving the ball a feeling of movement and speed it would otherwise lack.

The greatest shortcoming of the manga is that the side characters, particularly Taiyou’s mentor, Ryukoku, as well as his friend Etsuko, are largely thrown by the wayside in the latter half of the manga. This is disappointing as in Ashita no Joe or Ore wa Teppei, many of the side characters throughout the manga become interesting characters in their own right. There is the impression that, at least with Ryukoku, there may have been plans to give him his own backstory and character arc, what with his distinct appearance, combined with the mention that he was a pro himself back in the day, but this never comes to fruition. In addition, Taiyou’s family are never made to be particularly interesting characters in their own right, which is a shame considering that in Ore wa Teppei, Teppei’s father was an interesting and entertaining character in his own right. Apart from Taiyou and the other pro players, the most interesting characters are probably the caddies, of which most have colorful personalities, but they change every course, and never appear again afterwards, which can’t help but feel a little unfortunate.

Ashita Tenki ni Naare may not feature the distinctly memorable moments featured in some of Chiba’s other manga, and the lack of any notably interesting side characters will always feel like a bit of a missed opportunity. Still, for a work featuring a static sport portrayed in a static medium to be this engaging is certainly a commendable feat, and Chiba’s art and overall skill as a mangaka elevate the manga far above what it could have been otherwise. It's an enjoyable comic on its own, and also a great display of some of Chiba’s skillfulness as a mangaka. It also features a charismatic lead, whose development as a person and as a player is more than enough to make this manga worth reading.

                "Dungeons & Artifacts" is an exciting and engaging manhwa that offers a unique take on the dungeon-crawling genre. The story follows the adventurer Stetch Atelier, who is betrayed by a prince during a dungeon-guiding gig and is cursed to die. However, Stetch is resurrected by a sentient artifact that offers him a deal to get his revenge. To hold up his end of the bargain, Stetch embarks on a journey of raiding dungeons, slaying monsters, and making new enemies and friends along the way.

The story is well-crafted and the pacing is spot on, keeping readers engaged from start to finish. The characters are also well-written,
                  ...
with each having their own distinct backstory and motivations. The world-building is also top-notch, with a fantasy land setting that includes human kingdoms, elves, and dwarves, as well as dungeons filled with monsters and artifacts.

The standout feature of "Dungeons & Artifacts" is the execution of the plot. While the basic premise may seem similar to other stories in the genre, the author has done an extraordinary job at bringing their own unique twist to the story. The action scenes are consistent and amazing, with the artwork bringing them to life in a way that is both visually stunning and easy to follow.

Overall, I would highly recommend "Dungeons & Artifacts" to fans of fantasy and action manhwas. It's a well-crafted and engaging story with top-notch artwork and characters that will keep readers hooked from beginning to end. If you're looking for a unique take on the dungeon-crawling genre, this is definitely a manhwa to check out.

Evangelion: ANIMA
(Manga)
add

        (All reviews)
      







Mar 3, 2023
PorthosMoonPower
Recommended 





                If your favourite part of Evangelion was the religious imagery and lore, then you're in luck, because Anima certainly delivers in that aspect. Due to being in a novel format, Anima has the freedom to have lots of intriguing ideas that an anime wouldn't have the time to flesh out. The lore and mysteries of the original series (such as what exactly SEELE is) are expanded on in a way that feels consistent with Evangelion as a whole. The Christian references are more involved, prominent, and meaningful (though still fairly aesthetic and surface-level), and the global impact of the events is explored -- something the
                  ...
original series merely alluded to. As is the case with the Rebuilds, the psychological drama and existential angst of the original series are toned down in Anima, which works in Anima's favour because there can be a greater focus on action and lore. The ending is not all-out happy (after all, this is Evangelion), but it's not depressing and dark either. A bigger issue is that the ending feels rushed, and there's very little payoff (of any kind) and catharsis for the reader, which furthers the point that Anima is meant to be read for more Evangelion action and lore -- and more of that is never a bad thing.

If you love Evangelion and want more Evangelion between the manga, original series, and Rebuilds, Anima fills this niche. It feels like a natural extension of the original series and Rebuilds, which makes it all the more enjoyable.

Dusk Howler
add



- Both stories are adaptations of novels.
- "Tian Guan Ci Fu" is a shounen-ai and "Dusk Howler" is a bromance.
- Both stories have a warm and touching relationship between the two handsome main characters.  
- The main characters are a ''good'' guy and a ''bad'' guy, but in "Tian Guan Ci Fu" they are a couple in love, while in "Dusk Howler" they are a pupil and a teacher. 
- The ''good'' guy is a hardworking, humble and unlucky person who accidentally committed some crime and has to complete some quests as punishment for this crime.
- The ''bad'' guy is the great and terrible "demon", but he acts like a sweet and romantic person when he is around the ''good'' guy.
- Both stories have beautiful art and many interesting characters.
- Both stories have a cute, funny, mysterious and supernatural atmosphere with gods, demons, ghosts, etc. reportManga rec by Nancy_Drew - 6 hours ago

If you liked
Doctor's Rebirth
add








...then you might like
Dusk Howler
add



- Both webtoons are based on bromance novels by the same author, Taesun.
- Both webtoons are illustrated by yaoi artists: "Doctor's Rebirth" is illustrated by artist Dobin ("Master? Master!") and "Dusk Howler" is illustrated by artist Nansae ("The Master's Appetite").
- Both stories revolve around a bromance relationship between a teacher, a pupil and some third guy.
- All three main characters are androgynous bishounens.
- There are a few more bishounens in the story.

The novels "Dusk Howler" (shounen, bromance, VRMMORPG) and "Doctor's Rebirth" (shounen, bromance, isekai, medical) are the only Taesun's novels where the events take place in the "murim" (the "ancient Chinese" martial arts world). The novel "Dusk Howler" consists of two parts: the first part tells about the first server (the "European" world of sword and sorcery), while the second part tells about the second server (the "ancient Chinese" martial arts world), however, in the manhwa "Dusk Howler", there is only the "European" server because the novel "Dusk Howler" consists of about 12 volumes, but the manhwa "Dusk Howler" showed only the events from the first two volumes of the novel.

In the other novels by Taesun, events take place in the "European" world of sword and sorcery: "Game Master Mion" (shounen, VRMMORPG), "Dynamite" (shounen, romance, music, VRMMORPG), "Thanatos" (shounen, VRMMORPG), "Deadline of Silver" (shounen, fantasy, vampires), "The Phantom Master" (shounen, romance, fantasy, isekai), "The Dragon Master" (josei (where the protagonist is an asexual teenage boy who pretends to be a magical girl, and his love interest is a heterosexual teenage boy who is unrequitedly in love with this magical girl), magical academy, fantasy, post-apocalyptic), "Master of the Divine Beasts" (shoujo, romance, reverse harem, fantasy), "Chitra" (shoujo, romance, reverse harem, fantasy, isekai, game system). reportManga rec by Nancy_Drew - Yesterday, 9:10 PM

If you liked
Mo Dao Zu Shi
add








...then you might like
Dusk Howler
add



"The Founder of Diabolism" and "Dusk Howler" are mysterious action stories where several clans or guilds hunt undead, ghosts, demons, etc., but "The Founder of Diabolism" is a BL story that tells about a romantic relationship between the two bishounens, while "Dusk Howler" is a shounen story with BL subtext that tells about a bromance relationship between the three bishounens. 

Both stories are adaptations of the novels of the same name. Both the novel and the manhua "The Founder of Diabolism" take place in the "ancient Chinese" world where people learn martial arts to achieve immortality. Both the novel and the manhwa "Dusk Howler" take place mainly in the virtual MMORPG game "Trikia" and sometimes in modern South Korea. The first part of the novel "Dusk Howler" tells about the first server (the "European" world of sword and sorcery), while the second part tells about the second server (the "ancient Chinese" non-magical martial arts world), however, in the manhwa "Dusk Howler", there is only the "European" server because the novel "Dusk Howler" consists of about 12 volumes, but the manhwa "Dusk Howler" showed only the events from the first two volumes of the novel.

Nine, the deuteragonist in "Dusk Howler", is a romantic, eccentric and childish undead / necromancer who is similar to Wei Wuxian, the protagonist in "The Founder of Diabolism", while Mori, the tritagonist in "Dusk Howler", is a cold, strict and caring dark elf / swordsman who is similar to Lan Wangji, the deuteragonist in "The Founder of Diabolism".  

Nine and Mori are best friends who have been living together in a private home and acting like a loving married couple for several years, but they often quarrel and fight because Nine is a sexual pervert who likes to do indecent deeds, while Mori is an asexual tsundere who gets angry every time Nine behaves in an indecent manner. But the plot of "Dusk Howler" mainly revolves around the bromance relationship between Nine and the protagonist Jaiha and pays little attention to the bromance relationship between Nine and Mori. Jaiha is a shy, modest and hardworking human / wizard who agreed to become Nine's pupil because Nine promised that he would turn Jaiha from a pathetic loser into a great man.   

Both Wei Wuxian (the founder of Demonic Cultivation) and Nine (a.k.a. Chaos Lord, Dark Tower Master, etc.) are sweet and friendly jokers, but they have a reputation for being great and terrible villains because they have a huge power and regularly perform ambiguous actions. However, Wei Wuxian follows the path of a hero and does predominantly good deeds, while Nine follows the path of a villain and does predominantly evil deeds. reportManga rec by Nancy_Drew - Feb 28, 2023

Both stories include lore-centric worlds with a new mystery around every corner, a collection of charming and menacing characters you can't help but root for, and absolutely batshit insane stories written by authors who were probably on crack. Karakuri Circus focuses largely on worldbuilding and crafting its secrets to be revealed hundreds of chapters away, while Fourteen goes full force into its madness from chapter 1. Shiritori Riddle League
Challenge Period: January 01, 2023 to December 15, 2023 11:59 p.m. (PST)
Rules
(How to play will be explained in the next post)
General

Only post Sign-Up/Turn-in Forms in this thread.
All other posts go in the Challenge Discussion thread.
Please do not delete your post after signing up; it messes up the rest of the posts/links.
If you want to withdraw, please replace your post content with "Withdrawn" or leave it as is.
Please carefully read the rules, "How to Play" guide, and FAQ before asking questions.

Sign-Up Forms

Your sign-up form must be posted in this thread for you to be considered a challenge participant.
Each manga can only be used once within the challenge.
You must read at least the last 5 volumes or 50 chapters (if not physically published) of the manga you choose to use for the challenge (if you're not reading it in its entirety) during the challenge period.
If the manga is still being published, read until the most recently published chapter.
Manga, Manhua, Manhwa, One-shots & Doujinshi are allowed.
Light Novels and Novels are not allowed.
Re-reading is allowed.
Please specify the dates you started/completed each manga in the sign-up form.

Turn-In Forms

Once you have completed the challenge, use the turn-in form and post it as a new reply. 
Turn-ins should be posted once and they shouldn't be deleted afterwards. 
Confirm all items/details are correct before posting. Once you turn-in your challenge, you can't continue working on it.

Forms

You can change your form freely until you turn-in.
Only one form can be worked on at a time.
Only your first completed attempt will be added to the list of participants who completed the challenge.
For posted forms that are unreadable or missing much of the required information, you will be asked to fix this before we proceed with the inspection.
Use a readable font size/color.
More info about shiritori in the "How to Play" guide.


🍘 2023 Anime Watching Challenge 🍘 

Thanks for the interest!
Join the discussion on discord and help others, ask questions, and/or give suggestions related to the challenge.
Thanks to those that provided suggestions.
And thanks to @_Bri for the banners, and @Rinarin for the forum avatars, and the profile pictures.

How to Play the Manga Reading Challenge Shiritori!
Shiritori is a Japanese word game in which the players are required to say a word which begins with the final kana of the previous word.
Here, you will choose a manga for your first item, and the last letter (or syllable) has to be the same as your next manga's first letter (or syllable), and so on.
To finish the challenge, you need to complete a chain using the amount of items required for your chosen difficulty.Signing Up
Go to the Sign Up Code post, copy the provided code in its entirety, and paste it as a new reply to this thread.

Edit your post to replace the capitalized text with your information.

The following fields should be filled in now: Link to your list and Completed Manga.

Choose a difficulty based on the number of manga you want to read.
　　Eloquent: 12 items;　Writer: 24 items;　Author: 36 items;　Scholar: 48 items;　Laureate: 60 items

Edit your post to fill in your chosen difficulty.
This can be changed later.

Determine if you want to play using the last letter or last syllable rules. 

(optional) Grab a participant banner from our Banners List and show it off on your profile/forum signature.Completing Challenge Items
Begin completing manga challenge items and edit them into your sign-up post. For example: 
1. [Started: DATE] [Finished: DATE]
(1) Read a Manhua or a Manhwa.
MANGA_TITLE[*] [color=DIMGRAY][Started: DATE] [Finished: DATE][/color]
(1) Read a [url=https://myanimelist.net/topmanga.php?type=manhua]Manhua[/url] or a [url=https://myanimelist.net/topmanga.php?type=manhwa]Manhwa[/url].
[url=http://myanimelist.net/manga/ID_NUM]MANGA_TITLE[/url]becomes: 
1. [Started: Jan 10] [Finished: Feb 12] 
(1) Read a Manhua or a Manhwa. 
The Horizon[*] [color=GREEN][Started: Jan 10] [Finished: Feb 12][/color] 
(1) Read a [url=https://myanimelist.net/topmanga.php?type=manhua]Manhua[/url] or a [url=https://myanimelist.net/topmanga.php?type=manhwa]Manhwa[/url]. 
[url=http://myanimelist.net/manga/125036]The Horizon[/url]
DATE is when you started/finished each manga.
ID_NUM is found in the manga entry's URL. MANGA_TITLE is the main title of the entry.

Continue chaining manga together until you have enough items to complete your chosen difficulty. Remember, each manga can only be used once. 

There are two modes in this challenge, to make it a bit more interesting for the hardcore readers between us: last letter, and last syllable shiritori.
Last letter means only the last letter needs to be the same as the first letter of the next manga.
Last syllable means the last syllable needs to be the same as the first syllable of the next manga.


Example last letter:
Read a manga with a one word title: Akumetsu
Read a manga with a main character that wears glasses: Umineko no Naku Koro ni - Episode 1: Legend of the Golden Witch

Example last syllable:
Read a manga with a one word title: Akumetsu
Read a manga with a main character that wears glasses: Tsurezure Children

For the purposes of this challenge, last syllable (when it comes to English titles) refers to the last pair of consonant + vowel.
You can use full syllables for English titles, but it's not obligatory.

For example:
Fullmetal Alchemist -> Mister X wo Sagase -> See You Later, Mermaid -> Maid kara Haha ni Narimashita -> Tandem -> Demi-chan wa Kataritai
or
Tandem (Tandemu) -> Mushishi 

For Japanese titles, it refers to the last kana.
In katakana titles, a long vowel may either be ignored or considered as a vowel.

For example:
Hunter x Hunter (ハンターハンター, Hantaa Hantaa) -> Tamashii no Futago
or
Hunter x Hunter (ハンターハンター, Hantaa Hantaa) -> Another (アナザー, Anazaa) -> Zashiki Onna

Different from the usual rules of shiritori, you don't lose when you choose a manga that ends with n; it follows the same rule as any other letter (or syllable), except you can choose whether to add the previous letters to it.

For example:
D.Gray-man -> Naruto -> To LOVE-Ru
or
D.Gray-man -> Manhole -> Let's☆Lagoon 

Titles originally in English, such as Bleach or Fullmetal Alchemist, can be used without issue for last letter shiritori, but can be modified for last syllable shiritori if necessary.
You can either use the romanization of the title, such as Buriichi (from ブリーチ), or an alternative Japanese title, such as Hagane no Renkinjutsushi (as Furumetaru Arukemisuto is not a widely recognized romanization).
If in doubt, check the alternative titles in MAL. 

Acronyms are not valid for last syllable shiritori if there's a full title available.

For example:
FMA, HxH, GTO (Fullmetal Alchemist, Hunter x Hunter, Great Teacher Onizuka) 

Acronyms without full titles available can be romanized in order to use them for last syllable shiritori, following MAL's (or other databases') titles or asking staff.

For example:
SSS! into Esu Esu Esu (from エスエスエス)

Symbols at the start or end of a title can be chained with any other symbol.

Numbers at the start or end of a title count as letters and need to be the same (only the first and last digit, even in last syllable shiritori).


The items do not need to be completed in any specific order, but it is easier to plan ahead of time what you're going to read, as finding something that both starts with a specific letter (or syllable) and ends with a specific letter (or syllable) can be harder.

If you use a title other than the main title, please add it between parenthesis after the main title.

As long as you try to make it work and it makes sense, we are going to be lenient with the meaning of last syllable (for English titles), but it's up to the discretion of the staff. 
However, we don't recommend using English titles for last syllable shiritori unless you understand how shiritori usually works or are okay with asking for clarification and accepting the staff's decision.Turning In
Once all your items are completed, verify that all information in your sign-up form is filled in.

Copy and paste the following text into a new reply in this thread.

[color=#F08080]@MRC_mod
🔶 [b] Challenge Start Date: [/b] MONTH DAY, YEAR (example: January 01, 2023)
🔷 [b] Challenge Finish Date: [/b] DATE (example: December 15, 2023)

🔖 [b] Link to your completed manga list: [/b]https://myanimelist.net/mangalist/YOUR_USERNAME?status=2

✨ [b] Completed Manga (at sign-up): [/b] INITIAL_NUMBER

2023 Anime Watching Challenge: Sign Up — Discussion

Discord server for MRC/AWCJan 15, 12:19 AM#3MRC_modOfflineJan 2017186
Challenge List with Explanations

Screenshots are suggested as evidence for some items which require information that could change by the time/after you turn-in. 
The provided suggestions are manga that we approved to be valid.
You can still choose to use titles not tagged with the required elements at your own risk.
If it isn't apparent based on cover/description/character description, you may provide some sort of proof for it (for easier inspection).
That goes for info (like age, etc.) that might not be apparent, as well.
MRC Staff Jokers: For the difficulty you want to attempt, you can choose a select number of MRC Staff Jokers as a "wild card".
(Eloquent: 1 Joker, Writer: 2 Jokers, Author: 3 Jokers, Scholar: 4 Jokers, Laureate: 5 Jokers).
This means you don't have to fit them into any requirement - they are valid on their own.
Leave them under MRC Staff Jokers in your form, and delete the ones you didn't read when turning in.
However: You don't have to use them as wild cards (and thus a replacement).
If you want to read and fit them into a requirement, you can read as many of them as you want and the restriction above won't apply in this case.


CHALLENGE LIST (141 items)

Type Read a Manhua or a Manhwa.
Read a one-shot.
Read a doujinshi based on a series you've read.
Read a web/4-koma manga.
Read a collection of short stories. - They can be a compilation by the same author or by different authors.
Read a colored manga. - Either use a tagged manga or attach a screenshot showing the color. 
(It can't be a central single color page because of a special event or commemoration. It has to be the default state of the manga. Extra content doesn't count.) Suggestions: Full Color | Partially Colored | Accent Colors

Creators
Read a manga by your favorite author/artist.
Read a manga by an author/artist duo.
Read a manga by an author/artist you don't know.
Read a manga by an author/artist you don't like. - State a manga you've read by them already.
Read the first or earliest work of your favorite creator.

Years
Read a manga that started publishing before or in the 70s. - (19XX-1979)
Read a manga that started publishing in the 80s. - (1980-1989)
Read a manga that started publishing in the 90s. - (1990-1999)
Read a manga that started publishing in the 2000s. - (2000-2009)
Read a manga that started publishing in the 2010s. - (2010-2019)
Read a manga that started publishing in the 2020s. - (2020-2023)
Read a manga that started publishing in the year you joined MAL.
　
Adaptations
Read a manga based on an anime.
Read a manga based on a novel/light novel/web novel.
Read a manga that's been the source of one of your completed anime. - The anime should have "manga" as its source and be completed before you read the manga. You can use the Adapted to anime tag on mangaupdates for ideas. 
Read a manga that is scored higher than its anime adaptation.
Read a manga that has been adapted to live action. - You can also check out the "adapted to Chinese drama/Jdrama/Kdrama/live action/Taiwanese drama" tags on mangaupdates for ideas.
Read a manga that has not been adapted in any way.
Read a manga that has at least 2 anime seasons.

Stats
Read a manga ranked in the top 1000.
Read a manga that is not ranked. - Ranking must say N/A.
Read a manga with a score of 8 or above.
Read a manga with a score of 6 or lower.
Read a manga with more users listed in PTR than Completed.
Read a manga from a magazine with less than 250/200/150/100/50 titles in the database. - The difficulty of the item is based on the difficulty of the challenge, so 250 for Eloquent and 50 for Laureate.
Read a manga that is 1-3/4-6/7-9/10-12/13+ volumes in length. - The difficulty of the item is based on that of the challenge, so 1-3 volumes in length for Eloquent and 13+ for Laureate.
Read a manga with 25/50/100/150/200 chapters or more. - The difficulty of the item is based on that of the challenge, so 25+ chapters for Eloquent and 200+ for Laureate.
Read a manga ranked BELOW 2,000/4,000/6,000/8,000/10,000. - Example:10001, 10002, ... , etc. It has to be ranked. (No N/A!). The difficulty of the item is based on that of the challenge, so below 2,000 for Eloquent, below 10,000 for Laureate.
Read a manga with less than 1,000/750/500/250/100 completed members. - The difficulty of the item is based on that of the challenge, so less than 1,000 completed members for Eloquent and less than 100 for Laureate.
Read a manga with less than 10,000/8,000/6,000/4,000/2,000 total members. - The difficulty of the item is based on that of the challenge, so less than 10,000 total members for Eloquent and less than 2,000 for Laureate.
Read a manga with less than 250/200/150/100/50 favorites. - The difficulty of the item is based on that of the challenge, so less than 250 favorites for Eloquent and less than 50 for Laureate. 
Read a manga that started and finished publishing within 2/3/4/5/6 years or more. - E.g. Started publishing in 2010 and finished in 2012/2013/2014/2015/2016. The difficulty of the item is based on that of the challenge, so finished publishing within 2+ years for Eloquent and within 6+ for Laureate.
Read a manga by an author/artist who has published 4/6/8/10/12 manga or more. - The difficulty of the item is based on that of the challenge, so by an author who has published 4+ manga for Eloquent and 12+ manga for Laureate.

Demographics
Read a josei manga.
Read a shoujo manga.
Read a shounen manga.
Read a seinen manga.
Read a manga where the main character is the gender opposite to the demographic. - E.g. male MC in a shoujo or female MC in a seinen. Suggestions: Male Demographic with Female Lead | Female Demographic with Male Lead
Read a manga with a target demographic that does not apply to you.
Read a manga with a target demographic that can apply to you.

Themes & Genres
Read a Drama or Romance manga.
Read a Fantasy or Mystery manga.
Read a BL or GL manga.
Read a Comedy manga.
Read a Slice of Life manga.
Read a Food or Gourmet manga.
Read a Gender Bender manga. - Suggestions: Crossdressing, Magical Sex Shift, Trap
Read a Horror or Supernatural manga.
Read a Sports or Games manga. - See also High Stakes Game, Strategy Game, Video Game
Read an Action or Adventure manga.
Read a Super Power, Demon, or Vampire manga.
Read a Martial Arts, Historical, or Samurai manga.
Read a Mecha, Detective, or Military manga.
Read a Psychological or Suspense manga.
Read a Sci-Fi or Space manga.
Read a School manga.
Read a manga tagged with one of the explicit genres (Ecchi, Erotica, Hentai).
Read a manga that combines a tag that you like AND one that you dislike.
Read a manga tagged with your least favorite genre(s).
Read a manga with five or more genres.

Content-based
Read a battle royale / survival manga.
Read a CGDCT or Iyashikei manga.
Read a Magical Girl or Magical Boy manga. - Also: Mahou Shoujo
Read a manga about a family.
Read a manga about Music, or Art.
Read a manga about nature. - Anything set in nature or about the things in nature: mountains, ocean, the arctic, etc.
Read a manga featuring a deity. - Suggestions: Gods | Goddess/es
Read a manga featuring mythology or folklore.
Read a manga including time travel. - Suggestions: Time Travel | Time Traveller/s
Read a manga tagged under European Ambience. - The tag on Mangaupdates is required.
Read a manga tagged with Dystopia / Apocalypse / Post-Apocalyptic. - One of the mentioned tags on Mangaupdates is required.
Read a manga that takes place in feudal Japan. - Suggestions: Feudal Japan | Sengoku Era | Edo Period
Read a manga that takes place in the countryside.
Read a manga tagged under Atypical Art Style, Elaborate Art Style, Sketchy Art Style, or Realistic Art Style.
Read an isekai manga.
Read a manga with a Strong Female Lead.
Read a manga about zombies.
Read a manga focused on revenge.
Read an award-winning manga. - Make a note of which award the manga won.

Character-based
Read a manga with a listed cast of 8 or more people.
Read a manga with a main cast of 18+ year-olds. - The whole main cast must be 18+ years old.
Read a manga with a main character that is a professional in their field. - The MC needs to earn a living with it.
Read a manga with a main character that wears glasses. - Suggestions: Male MC | Female MC
Read a manga about characters with animal characteristics. - Personality or physical characteristics.
Read a manga with an animal main character.
Read a manga with an antihero or villain main character. - Suggestions: Anti-Hero/Heroine | Villain Protagonist | Reincarnated as the Villain/ness
Read a manga with both a child and an adult main character. - The child has to be 12 years old or younger, and the adult has to be 18 years old or older.
Read a manga with both a human and a non-human main character. - Any character that isn't human counts, even if they have a human appearance.
Read a manga that includes a character with a disability. - It has to be a non-temporary disability. Things like broken limbs don't count unless it's permanent.
Read a manga with an all male main cast.
Read a manga with an all female main cast.
Read a manga with the same number of male and female main characters.
Read a manga with more listed supporting characters than main characters.

Challenge & MAL related
Read a manga another MRC participant rated 9 or higher. - Link to their post and profile.
Read a manga another MRC participant rated 4 or lower. - Link to their post and profile.
Read a manga that an active MRC staff member has rated 9 or higher. - Note which staff member it was as well as the date, or add a screenshot.
Read a manga that is on one of the active MRC staff's Plan to Read list. - Note which staff member it was as well as the date, or add a screenshot.
Read a manga recommended by any MRC staff. - Anywhere is fine, add a screenshot and/or link to prove a staff member suggested it to you. Suggestions: discussion thread | our discord server
Read a manga recommended to you by another participant in the discussion thread. - Link to their post or add a screenshot, making sure to include their username.
Read an active MAL staff member's listed favorite manga.
Read a manga recommended to another manga you've read for this challenge. - Make a note of the previous manga.
Read any manga recommended to your Favorite Manga listed in profile. - Make sure to list your favorite manga.
Read a manga that appears when putting in your username.  - Advanced search, skip/exclude Hentai, Yaoi, Yuri if you wish - Add the following url to your form (replace both YOURUSERNAME with your username):YOURUSERNAME
Read a manga that started publishing on the day you joined MAL (any month/year).
Read a manga that started publishing in the month you joined MAL (any year).
Read a favorite from one of your MAL friends - so they finally stop telling you to do it. - Link to their profile.
Read a manga featured in an interest stack.
Read a manga featured in the user spotlight.

Miscellaneous
Read a manga with plants on the cover.
Read a manga with an animal on the cover.
Read a manga with a vehicle on the cover. - Cars, Trains, Bicycles, Airplanes, etc.
Read a manga with weather conditions on the cover. - Such as Rain, Snow, Fog, Thunder, etc.
Read a manga with no characters on the cover.
Read a manga with the same first and last letter. - Title must be at least 2 letters long.
Read a manga used in one of this year's MRC badges.
Read a manga used in one of the MRC badges of any year.
Read a manga suggested by MAL or by Anime+.
Read a manga whose title begins with the last letter of your username.
Read a manga with the same number of volumes as letters in your username.
Read a manga with 6 or more words in its title.
Read a manga with a one word title.
Read a manga with a symbol in the title. - Excluding punctuation (i.e., ~!@#$%&, etc.). Only symbols not on the keyboard count (i.e., ♪★☆♥△, etc.).
Read a featured manga.
Read a manga from the ones listed under manga relations in the Hidden Gems of Manga club.
Read a manga that was recently reviewed. - Recently reviewed means reviewed in the 3 months prior to starting it.
Read a manga series you can finish in one day.
Read a manga that got cancelled/axed.
Read a manga with no reviews. - Google: site:myanimelist.net/manga "no reviews have been submitted for this title"
Re-read a manga.
Read a manga with a number in the title.
Read a manga with a Japanese honorific in the title (e.g. chan, san, kun, sama, etc.)
Read a manga that takes place outside of Japan, but in the real world.
Read a manga with a series associated game. - Suggestions: Based on a Video Game, Adapted to Game, Based on an Otome Game, Based on a Card Game
Read a manga based on a one-shot.
Read a manga that is related to something you previously read. - Make a note of the previous manga.

2023 Anime Watching Challenge: Sign Up — Discussion

Discord server for MRC/AWCJan 15, 12:20 AM#6MRC_modOfflineJan 2017186
User Spotlight

Helck


@Nezperdian: "A gem that is often overlooked. Once you read a couple of volumes, you won't stop until the end due to how engrossing it becomes. Action, fantasy, feels, comedy, seriousness, uplifting message. While not perfect, you'll certainly find it worthy of your time. Plus, an anime was announced, so you may want to get ahead."

Konjiki no Gash!!


@PolloBroaster: "Gash is a perfect blend of slice of life, comedy, drama, and battle manga."

Previous Spotlights

Samurai Ragazzi:
Sengoku Shounen Seihou Kenbunroku


@BrainpanSonata: "An interesting deviation from the action/adventure shounen format."

Bokutachi ga Yarimashita


@Franchowo: "A unique story for the people that love to feel hard experiences in manga, as well as a dark setting."

Q


@RockRoller: "A short story about monsters, a weird girl, and donuts in a post apocalyptic world."

Blue Box


@3very: "The character interactions drive the manga, the sport is just the vehicle."

for when you want to feel something (anime)
Animeby
PoutyWeeb 
Inspired by bel’s list on letterboxd

https://letterboxd.com/ellefnning/list/for-when-you-want-to-feel-something/

A list filled with a wide variety of animes that’ll inflict emotions of some sort, whether it’s positive or negative (or perhaps even a mix of both). All the animes listed here are animes that has personally affected me, for better or for worse. I hope you can find something here that at least wouldn’t feel like another boring isekai and hopefully leaves some sort of lasting impact on your mind.

For simplicity’s sake, any animes with multiple entries I’ll only add the first entry and drop the most ideal watch order next to it.

This list will be constantly updating as I’m still watching more animes, so look out for more entries in the future!

Claiming to be Chuya’s older brother, the “King of Assassins” Paul Verlaine suddenly appears, threatening to kill everyone Chuya holds dear. Chuya teams up with Adam, an AI investigator from Europe, to put a stop to Paul’s plans before another storm engulfs Yokohama. Secrets enveloped in darkness until now are brought to light, including the answer to Chuya’s most pressing question — is he himself even human?

Support


Please read the following before filling out the “Contact Customer Support” form. The link to the form is located at the bottom.
English is the only available language for MAL support; we are unable to answer inquiries in any other languages. We apologize for the inconvenience.
Password Recovery
If you are unable to login to your account, please follow the steps which apply to you.
I know my registered email and have access to it
Please go here and request a new password. If it does not arrive to your inbox after several minutes, please check your spam/junk folders. If the password still does not arrive (Hotmail, Live, and Outlook email domains), please click the "contact customer support" button and fill out the form including "I know my registered email and have access, but the email does not arrive" at the top of the inquiry.
I don't remember my registered email
Please go here and select "I do not remember the email address registered on my MAL account". An email will be sent to your provided email address with a hint to your registered email. If it does not arrive to your inbox after several minutes, please enter a different email address.
I know my registered email, but do not have access to it
Please go here and select "I cannot use the email address registered on my MAL account anymore". The form will use your old password (if your account is still locked from May 2018) and other information from your device to verify your identity. If the form succeeds, you will be sent a new password to your provided email within several minutes.

No email arrives after completing the form
Please check your spam/junk folders. If it's not there, please enter a different email address. Hotmail, Live, and Outlook email domains often have problems receiving our emails.
The email says the form cannot verify my identity
The form uses your last login information, so please:

try completing the form with all of your devices (mobile, desktop, tablet)
try at all possible locations (work, home, school)
ensure your last password is correct by checking your browser settings for saved passwords (e.g. chrome://settings/passwords in Chrome)

I tried all my devices, at all locations, and still cannot get a new password
Please collect any information that we could use to verify your identity. This includes:

receipts from MAL Supporter payments or Manga Store purchases
other email addresses or social media accounts (Steam, Twitch, Reddit, Discord, Twitter, Last.fm) that you have written publicly on your MAL account ("Also Available At").

Once you have this information, please click the "contact customer support" button and fill out the form, write
      "I do not have access to my registered email and the form won't help me" at the top, and include all of this information in your inquiry.

Two Factor Authentication (2FA)
We recommend to increase your account security by enabling a second verification step after your password. To activate or deactivate this feature, please follow the instructions on the account settings page.

I lost access to the authentication app on my smart device
    When you enabled 2FA, you were given 5 backup codes to save in a safe place. If you've lost access to the authentication app on your smart device, you can use one of these backup codes to log in. When prompted to enter the 6-digit app code, click "enter an unused backup code instead". Please note that each backup code can only be used once.
  

I lost access to the app and my backup codes
    If you cannot log in because you lost access to both the app and your backup codes, please click the "contact customer support" button and fill out the form using your registered email address. Write "I cannot access my 2FA app and lost my backup codes" at the top, and include any other information we can use to verify your identity in your inquiry.
  
Account Deletion
All account deletion requests are permanent. You cannot reactivate a deleted account or recover any account information after requesting a deletion. This includes purchased manga, MAL supporter status, anime/manga lists, private messages, and more.
You must save any information you would like to keep before requesting the deletion. Forum posts made by you will remain as "removed_user", so please manually delete any you would like erased.

I know my registered email and have access to it
    Please go here after saving any information you would like to keep.
  


The form says my entered email is invalid
      Note that you cannot delete your account through the above link if your account:
- is currently banned or has been banned in the past (you will need to contact customer support)
- has changed its email address in the last 30 days (please wait before requesting a deletion)
- is a MAL supporter (you can cancel your Supporter status here)


No email arrives after completing the form
      Please check your spam/junk folders. If it's not there and you are confident you entered the correct email address, please click the "contact customer support" button and fill out the form.
    


I know my registered email, but do not have access to it
    Please follow the steps below.
  


I can log in to my account
      Go to your account settings and update your registered
      email to a valid one. Please note you will need to wait 30 days before deleting your account using the link
      above as a safety measure.
    

I cannot log in to my account
      Please click the "contact customer support" button and fill out the form. After the necessary identity
      verification procedures are completed, we will delete your account within 30 days and inform you by email.
      Please do not change your login information (username, email) during this time or it may delay the process.
    

Android & iOS Apps

    The official MyAnimeList app is now available for Android and iOS smartphones. As of November 2020, the app is in the first phase of development and will be continuously
    expanded with time.
  









    For all customer support related to the official app, please see the FAQ and contact links here.
  
API

    MyAnimeList has released a public API which allows you to send and retrieve data without using the MAL website. To
    use the API, you must first provide information about your application and obtain a client ID. You can do this in
    the API tab of your profile settings (MAL account required). 
 Our customer support team will not provide answers to technical questions about the API or how to use it. For
    inquiries, bug reports, and other support, please use the MAL API
      Club.
  
Bug Reports & Technical Errors
To report bugs, please use our Support Forum.
    Before creating a new topic, please read the Support Board Rules
    thread for more information on how to report problems. This includes, for example:
  
Anime/Manga List problems
Image upload errors
Display problems
Statistics errors
HTML 500/400/XXX errors
Unable to send/receive private messages

Abuse Reports (Users, Images, Posts, etc.)
On all pages with user content, there are "Report" links; please use these to report abuse and other problems which do not meet our Site Guidelines. "Report" links are located:

  
User profile: top-right corner of the page
Profile comment: below each comment
Private Messages: below each message
Forum: bottom-right of each post
Club: bottom of the main club page
Database images: below each image on the "Pictures" tab

You can also submit a general Abuse Report if the issue is larger than a single instance.
Database Problems (Anime, Manga, etc.)
To make database change requests, additions, or report other problems, please go here.
  
MAL Supporter
Please first read our MAL Supporter FAQ, as many common problems are already described there. If you cannot find your issue, then please click the "contact customer support" button and fill out the form.
Manga Store
Please first read our Manga Store FAQ, as many common problems are already described there. If you cannot find your issue, then please click the "contact customer support" button and fill out the form.
Suggestions for Features/Changes
To suggest site changes or new features, please use our Suggestions Forum.
Other Inquiries
For all other inquiries, please use our Support Forum. If the matter is
    regarding your personal information, then please click the "contact customer support" button and fill out the form,
    instead.

About MyAnimeList.net

MyAnimeList.net is the world's largest anime and manga database and community created by an anime fan, for anime fans. We provide users with a quick and no-hassle way to catalog their anime and manga collections, as well as a platform to communicate with like minded fans, and keep up to date with important industry news.
Each month we display 150 million page views to over 12 million unique visitors.
MyAnimeList users are very passionate about anime and manga! Let us help you connect with them in a meaningful way.

Watch Cool Doji Danshi~　✧　Nov 9, 2012 4:44 AM#2KinetaLead AdminFaerie QueenOfflineAug 20075960Database Problems

I can't find a particular anime/manga entry on MAL.
First of all, make sure the entry meets the Database Guidelines.  Foreign productions (e.g. Avatar, Original English Language "manga") and Korean webcomics are not allowed.

You may also check the recent posts in the removals/merges/denials threads for the entry you are concerned about, to ensure it hasn't been submitted and denied before.
Anime | Manga | Characters & People

Some series are hard to find with the MAL search. If the title is not in the threads above, you can try searching the title by using Google. Use these queries:
site:myanimelist.net/anime "anime title" | site:myanimelist.net/manga "manga title"

If you still cannot find the entry you are looking for, you may submit it to the database.


I would like to add a new anime/manga/character/person to the database.
First make sure that you have gone through the steps above. If you cannot find a denial for the entry and it meets our guidelines, you can add the entry here:
Add Anime | Add Manga | Add Character | Add People

A moderator will review your submission and approve or deny it. This may take a while, so please wait patiently.


How long does it take for submissions to be approved?
Currently, the queue is quite long. Depending on the importance of the submission, it can take a few days up to a few months until it gets approved. Please wait patiently and do not re-submit your submission as this will slow down the entire process.


I would like to modify a database entry.
Under the main picture and on the right side of some sections of every entry are "Edit" links.  Please use them to submit modifications to be approved.  If the edit button does not have the option you would like to submit, please use one of the respective threads:
Anime DB Modifications | Manga DB Modifications


I have a question about a database entry.
First familiarize yourself with the Database Guidelines. If your question is unanswered, please post your question in the respective subboard.
Anime | Manga | Characters & People


A database entry disappeared from my list/favorites.
Check the recent posts in the removals/merges/denials threads for the entry you are concerned about.
Anime | Manga | Characters & PeopleLunaMay 25, 2020 7:42 AM

Nov 9, 2012 4:44 AM#3KinetaLead AdminFaerie QueenOfflineAug 20075960Account Problems

My IP address / MAL account is restricted and I feel this is an error.
Click the contact button on the ban page to create a ticket. Someone will get back to you about the ban.


I'm/my friend is having problems receiving the password recovery / confirmation email.
Please contact Customer Support here.


I/my friend has forgotten their password.
You can request a new password here.


How do I delete my account?
Please see the "Account Deletion" section on the support page for instructions.


I would like to have the username of an inactive account.
We no longer free up names taken by inactive accounts. Please see here for more information.


How do I add or change my avatar/signature/username/list settings/list design/other personal information?
Go here. At the top there are several tabs where you can change all kinds of account information.


I have a problem/question about the parental consent process.
Please contact Customer Support here.


I have a problem/question about MAL Supporter.
Please check the MAL Supporter FAQ. If the FAQ doesn't answer your question please contact Customer Support here.


I'm being told that I have new club invitations but I don't.
Use the Reset Invite Counter link on the  club invitation page.


I can't add a favorite to my list even though I have room for it.
Clear all of your favorites (the link is at the bottom of the favorites edit list), wait a few minutes and then re-add everything.


How can I make my profile private?
It's not possible. If you don't want others to see personal information don't fill out the fields and use PMs for conversation.


How can I remove my own reviews/recommendations?
See here for reviews and here for recommendations.


I found an illegitimate account (spambot/rating troll/etc.) and would like to report it.
Rating trolls: We have a system that detects such accounts automatically. For more information see here.
Spambots: Please report spam directly by using the report links (forum post, comments, PMs). If there is no report link (blogs, VA pages) please use the report link on the user profile.
Other: Please use the report link on the user profile and provide a detailed explanation.


Trying to post a review gives me a "400 Bad Request" error. Help!
This usually happens if you use the browser addon "LastPass" (or another addon that interferes with the website). If you disable it, you should be able to post the review.LunaOct 3, 2021 12:14 AM
